summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon, seeking telephone records for specific numbers from 2002-2006 as part of a criminal investigation into violations of sex trafficking and related statutes. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve investigation confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoff E. Becan
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding Verizon to produce records and appear before the grand jury.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Date by which Verizon is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: Date the grand jury subpoena was issued to Verizon for telephone records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, indicating a serious federal probe into sex trafficking activities.
The subpoena seeks extensive telephone records from Verizon for specific numbers covering a five-year period from January 1, 2002, through December 31, 2006.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested Verizon not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation and prevent interference.
The document reveals an active investigation as of June 2019, focusing on historical evidence from the early-to-mid 2000s.
